Context:
This table is about the section 3.4 Modeling Nod e > 3.4.1 Adaptive NN. 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = [image:rId273][image:rId274]; row 1, column 2 = Neural Network (NN) is a machine learning model with hidden layers to uncover the complex, non-linear relationships between the data. Adaptive Neural Networks (Adaptive NNs) are neural networks that adjust their learning process or structure to suit input data or the learning environment.
table_html: [image:rId273][image:rId274] Neural Network (NN) is a machine learning model with hidden layers to uncover the complex, non-linear relationships between the data. Adaptive Neural Networks (Adaptive NNs) are neural networks that adjust their learning process or structure to suit input data or the learning environment.

Conjugate Gradient. Levenberg Marquardt.; row 5, column 1 = ; row 5, column 2 = Number of Hidden Layers; row 5, column 3 = Select Number of Hidden Layers.; row 5, column 4 = Required; row 5, column 5 = 1 or 2
table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Optimizing Method Set the method of weight updates. Required Steepest Descent. Conjugate Gradient. Levenberg Marquardt.
Number of Hidden Layers Select Number of Hidden Layers. Required 1 or 2
Number of nodes in Hidden Layers #1 Set the number of nodes in the first hidden layer. Required 0<integer
Number of nodes in Hidden Layers #2 Set the number of nodes in the second hidden layer. Required 0<integer
Activation Function of Hidden Layer #1 Select the activation function of the first hidden layer. Required Linear, Tanh, Sigmoid
Activation Function of Hidden Layer #2 Select the activation function of the second hidden layer. Required Linear, Tanh, Sigmoid
Output Layer Activation Function Select the activation function of the output layer. Required Linear, Tanh, Sigmoid
Momentum Set the degree to which the weight reflects the existing direction of movement if Optimizing Method is Steepest Descent. Required Default:0.900≤real number<1
Learning Rate Set the degree of weight updates if Optimizing Method is Steepest Descent. Required 0<real number≤1
Run Count Enter the maximum number of iterations. Required Default:100, 0<integer
Final Target Error Set the target error at which the algorithm stops iterating once the error between the actual and desired responses is reached. Required
Epsilon 1 Enter Epsilon 1 if Optimizing Method is Levenberg Marquardt. Required
Epsilon 2 Enter Epsilon 2 if Optimizing Method is Levenberg Marquardt. Required
Structural Optimization Decide whether to optimize the structure when the Split Node is connected. Required Yes, No
Start Node Count of Hidden Layer #1 Set the number of starting nodes in the first hidden layer if Structural Optimization is Yes. Conditionally Required 0<integer
Increase In Nodes of Hidden Layer #1 Set the number of nodes to increase in the first hidden layer if Structural Optimization is Yes. Conditionally Required 0<integer
Test Case Count of Hidden Layer #1 Set the number of test cases in the first hidden layer if Structural Optimization is Yes. Conditionally Required 0<integer
Start Node Count of Hidden Layer #2 Set the number of starting nodes in the second hidden layer if Structural Optimization is Yes. Conditionally Required 0<integer
Increase In Nodes of Hidden Layer #2 Set the number of nodes to increase in the second hidden layer if Structural Optimization is Yes. Conditionally Required 0<integer
Test Case Count of Hidden Layer #2 Set the number of test cases in the second hidden layer if Structural Optimization is Yes. Conditionally Required 0<integer

Context:
This table is about the section 3.4 Modeling Nod e > 3.4.1 Adaptive NN > Node Properties. 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = NOTE For example, if the number of starting nodes is 1, the number of incremental nodes is 2, and the number of test cases is 4, then we will test for cases 1, 3, 5, and 7. If the number of tests in the first hidden layer is 4 and the number of tests in the second hidden layer is 5, then we will test for a total of 20 cases.
table_html: NOTE For example, if the number of starting nodes is 1, the number of incremental nodes is 2, and the number of test cases is 4, then we will test for cases 1, 3, 5, and 7. If the number of tests in the first hidden layer is 4 and the number of tests in the second hidden layer is 5, then we will test for a total of 20 cases.

table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Optimization Technique Select the Numerical Method to optimize the objective function. Required Gradient Descent, AdaGrad, RMSProp, ADAM
Hidden Layer Count Configuration Select Number of Hidden Layers. Required 1, 3
Feature Hidden Layer Node Count Enter the number of nodes in the Feature hidden layer. Required natural number
Feature Hidden Layer Activation Function Feature Specifies the activation function of the hidden layer. Required Linear, Tanh, Sigmoid, ReLU, Leaky ReLU, ELU
Symmetric Hidden Layer Node Count Enter the number of nodes in the symmetric hidden layer. Required natural number
Symmetric Hidden Layer Activation Function Specifies the activation function of the symmetric hidden layer. Required Linear, Tanh, Sigmoid, ReLU, Leaky ReLU, ELU
Output Layer Activation Function Specifies the activation function of the output layer. Required Linear, Tanh, LogSig, ReLU, Leaky ReLU, ELU
Run Count Enter the maximum number of training iterations. Required natural number
Final Target Error Learning stops when the target error is reached. Required Real number
Batch Size Set the batch size. Required natural number
Learning Rate Set the Learning Rate when learning weights. Required Real number
Momentum When calculating the weight for the opposite direction of the gradient, enter the amount of reflection of the direction from the previous step. Required Real number
Gamma Specifies the Gamma value used in the RMSProp algorithm. Required Real number
Beta1 Specifies the Beta1 value used in the ADAM algorithm. Required Real number
Beta2 Specifies the Beta2 value used in the ADAM algorithm. Required Real number

Context:
This table is about the section 3.4 Modeling Nod e > 3.4.4 CART > Node Properties. 
Title: Node Properties 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = Property group; row 1, column 2 = Property Name; row 1, column 3 = Description; row 1, column 4 = Misc.; row 1, column 5 = Note; row 2, column 1 = Model File; row 2, column 2 = Save Model File; row 2, column 3 = Decide whether to save model file.; row 2, column 4 = Required; row 2, column 5 = Yes, No; row 3, column 1 = ; row 3, column 2 = Model File Path; row 3, column 3 = Set the path for the model file to be saved; row 3, column 4 = Conditionally Required; row 3, column 5 = ; row 4, column 1 = Selection options; row 4, column 2 = Impurity Function; row 4, column 3 = Specify the impurity function (Default is Gini); row 4, column 4 = Required; row 4, column 5 = Gini, Twoing, Entropy, LSD; row 5, column 1 = ; row 5, column 2 = Misclassification Cost; row 5, column 3 = ‘Default’ sets the misclassification cost as 1 for correct classifications and 0 for misclassifications across all classes. To assign different costs to each class, select Custom and specify the values.; row 5, column 4 = Required; row 5, column 5 = Default, Custom
table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved Conditionally Required
Selection options Impurity Function Specify the impurity function (Default is Gini) Required Gini, Twoing, Entropy, LSD
Misclassification Cost ‘Default’ sets the misclassification cost as 1 for correct classifications and 0 for misclassifications across all classes. To assign different costs to each class, select Custom and specify the values. Required Default, Custom
Occupancy Input Occupancy Input refers to the proportion of each class within the data. By default, the same percentage is applied to all classes. Required Default, Custom
Criterion Define whether to build the tree automatically or manually based on the selected options. Required Automatic, Manual
Min Samples Split Set the minimum number of data required to split a tree node. Activated when the Criterion option is set to ‘Automatic’. (Default is 5) Conditionally Required Value>0
Pruning Choose whether to prune the generated tree. Activated when the Criterion option is set to ‘Automatic’. Conditionally Required Yes, No
Max Tree Depth The maximum depth of the tree. Activated when the Criterion option is set to ‘Automatic’. Default: None (nodes are expanded until all leaves are pure or contain fewer than Min Samples Split) Conditionally Required Value>0
Impurity Threshold A node becomes a stationary node if its impurity is below the specified impurity threshold. Activated when the Criterion option is set to ‘Automatic’. Conditionally Required 0≤value≤1
Impurity Change Threshold If the impurity change for a node is below the specified threshold, the node is considered a terminal node. Activated only when the Criterion option is set to ‘Automatic’, and Pruning option is set to ‘No’. Conditionally Required 0≤value≤1

Context:
This table is about the section 3.4 Modeling Nod e > 3.4.6 CNN. 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = [image:rId319][image:rId320]; row 1, column 2 = Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) is a type of deep learning model that utilizes multiple convolutional and pooling layers to automatically learn features from input images. These features enable CNN to perform tasks such as classification or prediction. CNN excels at understanding the spatial structure within image data, allowing it to identify and extract intricate patterns or structure.
table_html: [image:rId319][image:rId320] Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) is a type of deep learning model that utilizes multiple convolutional and pooling layers to automatically learn features from input images. These features enable CNN to perform tasks such as classification or prediction. CNN excels at understanding the spatial structure within image data, allowing it to identify and extract intricate patterns or structure.

Title: Node Properties 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = Property group; row 1, column 2 = Property Name; row 1, column 3 = Description; row 1, column 4 = Misc.; row 1, column 5 = Note; row 2, column 1 = Model File; row 2, column 2 = Save Model File; row 2, column 3 = Decide whether to save model file.; row 2, column 4 = Required; row 2, column 5 = Yes, No; row 3, column 1 = ; row 3, column 2 = Model File Path; row 3, column 3 = Set the path for the model file to be saved.; row 3, column 4 = Conditionally Required; row 3, column 5 = ; row 4, column 1 = Selection options; row 4, column 2 = Input Image Path Variable; row 4, column 3 = Select the Input Image string-type variable that contains the source path information.; row 4, column 4 = Required; row 4, column 5 = variable name; row 5, column 1 = ; row 5, column 2 = Image Color Space; row 5, column 3 = Decide whether the input image is color or black and white.; row 5, column 4 = Required; row 5, column 5 = Color, black and white
table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Input Image Path Variable Select the Input Image string-type variable that contains the source path information. Required variable name
Image Color Space Decide whether the input image is color or black and white. Required Color, black and white
Network Type Specify structure of the convolution neural network for modeling Required LeNet-5, AlexNet, VGGNet
Use Initial Padding Decide whether to apply Initial Padding to the Input Image. Required Yes, No
Top Padding Sets the initial padding size to be applied to the top of the Input Image if Use Initial Padding is Yes.. Conditionally Required 0≤Integer
Bottom Padding Sets the initial padding size to be applied to the Bottom of the Input Image if Use Initial Padding is Yes... Conditionally Required 0≤Integer
Left Padding Sets the initial padding size to be applied to the left side of the Input Image if Use Initial Padding is Yes. Conditionally Required 0≤Integer
Right Padding Sets the initial padding size to be applied to the right of the Input Image if Use Initial Padding is Yes. Conditionally Required 0≤Integer
Optimization Technique Set the method of weight updates. Required Gradient Descent with Momentum, AdaGrad, RMSProp, ADAM
Learning Rate Set the degree of weight updates during the Optimization Technique. Required 0<real number≤1
Momentum Set the degree to which the weight reflects the existing direction of movement if Optimizing Method is Gradient Descent with Momentum. Conditionally Required 0<real number≤1
Gamma Set the rate at which previously updated weights are remembered if Optimization Technique is RMSProp. Conditionally Required 0≤real number<1
Beta1 Set the degree to which the weight reflects the existing direction of movement if Optimization Technique is ADAM. Conditionally Required 0≤real number<1
Beta2 Set the rate for remembering previously updated weights if the Optimization Technique is ADAM. Conditionally Required 0≤real number<1
Batch Size Set the number of data to update at once in mini-batch gradient descent. Required 0<integer≤k (k: number of data)
Number of Epochs Set the number of epochs Required 0<integer

table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Input Image Path Variable Select the Input Image string-type variable that contains the source path information. Required variable name
Image Color Space Decide whether the input image is color or black and white. Required Color, black and white
Network Type Specify structure of the convolution neural network for modeling Required LeNet-5, AlexNet, VGGNet
Use Initial Padding Decide whether to apply Initial Padding to the Input Image. Required Yes, No
Top Padding Sets the initial padding size to be applied to the top of the Input Image if Use Initial Padding is Yes.. Conditionally Required 0≤Integer
Bottom Padding Sets the initial padding size to be applied to the Bottom of the Input Image if Use Initial Padding is Yes... Conditionally Required 0≤Integer
Left Padding Sets the initial padding size to be applied to the left side of the Input Image if Use Initial Padding is Yes. Conditionally Required 0≤Integer
Right Padding Sets the initial padding size to be applied to the right of the Input Image if Use Initial Padding is Yes. Conditionally Required 0≤Integer
Optimization Technique Set the method of weight updates. Required Gradient Descent with Momentum, AdaGrad, RMSProp, ADAM
Learning Rate Set the degree of weight updates during the Optimization Technique. Required 0<real number≤1
Momentum Set the degree to which the weight reflects the existing direction of movement if Optimizing Method is Gradient Descent with Momentum. Conditionally Required 0<real number≤1
Gamma Set the rate at which previously updated weights are remembered if Optimization Technique is RMSProp. Conditionally Required 0≤real number<1
Beta1 Set the degree to which the weight reflects the existing direction of movement if Optimization Technique is ADAM. Conditionally Required 0≤real number<1
Beta2 Set the rate for remembering previously updated weights if the Optimization Technique is ADAM. Conditionally Required 0≤real number<1
Batch Size Set the number of data to update at once in mini-batch gradient descent. Required 0<integer≤k (k: number of data)
Number of Epochs Set the number of epochs Required 0<integer

Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Run Count Select the maximum number of times to train the dataset. Required natural number
Final Target Error Select the minimum error condition for learning to end. Required 0<real number
Loss Function Select the type of loss function. If Loss Function is Cross Entropy, SoftMax activation function is automatically applied. Required Sum of Squared Error, Cross Entropy
Output Layer Activation Function Select the activation function of the output layer if Loss Function is Sum of Squared Error. Conditionally Required Linear, Tanh, Log Sigmoid, ReLU, Leaky ReLU, ELU
Optimization Technique Set the method of weight updates. Required Gradient Descent With Momentum, ADAM, Adagrad, RMSProp
Batch Size Set the number of data to update at once in mini-batch gradient descent. Required 0<integer≤k (k: number of data)
Learning Rate Set the degree of weight updates during optimization technique. Required 0<real number≤1
Momentum Set the degree to which the weight reflects the existing direction of movement if Optimization Technique is Gradient Descent with Momentum. Conditionally Required 0≤real number<1
Gamma Set the rate at which previously updated weights are remembered if Optimization Technique is RMSProp. Conditionally Required 0≤real number<1
Beta1 Set the degree to which the weight reflects the existing direction of movement if Optimization Technique is ADAM. Conditionally Required 0≤real number<1
Beta2 Set the rate at which ADAM Optimization Technique remembers previously updated weights if Optimization Technique is ADAM. Conditionally Required 0≤real number<1
Selection options -Hidden Layer Configuration Add Hidden Layer Add a hidden layer of the model. button
Remove Last Hidden Layer Remove the last hidden layer of the model. button
Selection options -Hidden Layer # Number of Nodes Set the number of perceptron in the hidden layer. Required natural number
Activation Function Select the activation function of the hidden layer. Required Linear, Tanh, Log Sigmoid, ReLU, Leaky ReLU, ELU

table_html: [image:rId334] ElmanNet is type of the recurrent neural with a single hidden layer, commonly used for predictive analysis (Regression). It features a context layer that stores information from previous time steps, allowing the network to make predictions based on past data.

Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Number of Nodes Specify the number of nodes in the hidden layer. Required Integer < 100
Hidden Layer Activation Function Specify the activation function of the hidden layer. Required Sigmoid
Weighting Initialization Specification Specify whether to manually set the initial weights of the neural network. Required Yes, No
Initial Weighting From Specify the starting point of the random range for weight initialization. Selection options -1 ≤ Real Number ≤ 1.-0.5 by default

Number of Epochs Specifies the maximum number of epochs for performing the algorithm Required natural number

Momentum Specify the extent to which the previous step's direction is incorporated when calculating the weight for the gradient direction during training. Required 0≤real number≤1
Batch Size Specify the batch size to be used for the BPTT(Back Propagation Through Time) algorithm during training. Required natural number ≤ 200
Learning Log Specify the interval for displaying logs during training Required Natural Number

Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Number of Factors Enter the number of common factors. The number of common factors must be less than the number of input variables. Required natural number
Pre-processing Method Choose standardization as a pre-processing method. Required standardization.

Context:
This table is about the section 3.4 Modeling Nod e > 3.4.20 PLS. 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = [image:rId456] [image:rId457]; row 1, column 2 = Partial least squares (PLS) is a statistical method commonly used for dimensionality reduction, regression analysis. PLS is used to analyze data where there is a large correlation between independents or where the number of variables is greater than the number of observations. If there is a multicollinearity problem, PLS reduces the number of predictors by transforming them into latent variables. The application fields are chemometrics, bioinformatics, and finance. About Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and PLS, PLS focuses on explaining variance in both predictors and responses while PCA focuses only on explaining variance in the predictors.
table_html: [image:rId456] [image:rId457] Partial least squares (PLS) is a statistical method commonly used for dimensionality reduction, regression analysis. PLS is used to analyze data where there is a large correlation between independents or where the number of variables is greater than the number of observations. If there is a multicollinearity problem, PLS reduces the number of predictors by transforming them into latent variables. The application fields are chemometrics, bioinformatics, and finance. About Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and PLS, PLS focuses on explaining variance in both predictors and responses while PCA focuses only on explaining variance in the predictors.

table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Total Number of Trees Set the number of branches to be generated. (Default : 100) Required Natural Number
Variable Selection Method Selection for the number of features in tree. (Default : Automatic, sqrt(k) for classification, and k/3 for regression. k: number of independent variables) Required Automatic, Designate
Selected Variable Count Set the number of variables to be used in tree if Variable Selection Method option is set to be Designate. Required Natural number
Sample Size Specification Method Set sample size for bagging technique Required Percentage, Count
Percentage Specify the sample size as a percentage when ‘Percentage’ is selected for the Sample Size Specification Method. Optional 0<real number <100
Count Specify the sample size as a count when ‘Count’ is selected for the Sample Size Specification Method. Optional 0< integer <N (N: number of data)
Impurity Function Specify the impurity function. (Default : Gini) Required Gini, Twoing, Entropy, LSD
Use OOB Decide whether to use Out-of-bag testing. Required Yes, No
Min Samples Split Set the minimum number of data required to split a tree node (Default : 5) Required
Max Tree Depth Specify the maximum depth of each tree. Default: None (nodes are expanded until all leaves are pure or contain fewer than Min Samples Split) Required
Impurity Threshold A node becomes a stationary node if its impurity is below the specified impurity threshold. Required
Impurity Change Threshold If the impurity change for a node is below the specified threshold, the node is considered a terminal node. Required

table_html: [image:rId489] [image:rId490] RBF(Radial-Basis Function) network is a supervised neural network with a single hidden layer. Its mathematical form is similar to a standard neural network, but it uses a radial basis function as the combination function in the hidden layer, instead of a typical activation function.

This table is about the section 3.4 Modeling Nod e > 3.4.24 RBF DDA > Node Properties. 
Title: Node Properties 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = Property group; row 1, column 2 = Property Name; row 1, column 3 = Description; row 1, column 4 = Misc.; row 1, column 5 = Note; row 2, column 1 = Model File; row 2, column 2 = Save Model File; row 2, column 3 = Decide whether to save model file.; row 2, column 4 = Required; row 2, column 5 = Yes, No; row 3, column 1 = ; row 3, column 2 = Model File Path; row 3, column 3 = Set the path for the model file to be saved.; row 3, column 4 = Conditionally Required; row 3, column 5 = ; row 4, column 1 = Selection options; row 4, column 2 = θ +; row 4, column 3 = Add a new RBF if the responses of RBFs of the class to which the data belongs to new data are all less than this value, during the RBF DDA training process.; row 4, column 4 = Required; row 4, column 5 = ; row 5, column 1 = ; row 5, column 2 = θ -; row 5, column 3 = Set the default value to adjust the value of RBF during the RBF DDA training process.; row 5, column 4 = Required; row 5, column 5 =
table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options θ + Add a new RBF if the responses of RBFs of the class to which the data belongs to new data are all less than this value, during the RBF DDA training process. Required
θ - Set the default value to adjust the value of RBF during the RBF DDA training process. Required
Percentage of Min Extraction Data Set percentage of RBFs to search during the training. This parameter is to speed up the algorithm. Due to the nature of the RBF DDA algorithm, each time new data comes in and a new RBF is created, it changes or adds the value while searching all existing RBFs. Training time can be reduced by selecting only some RBFs in this process. Required

Title: Node Properties 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = Property group; row 1, column 2 = Property Name; row 1, column 3 = Description; row 1, column 4 = Misc.; row 1, column 5 = Note; row 2, column 1 = Model File; row 2, column 2 = Save Model File; row 2, column 3 = Decide whether to save model file.; row 2, column 4 = Required; row 2, column 5 = Yes, No; row 3, column 1 = ; row 3, column 2 = Model File Path; row 3, column 3 = Set the path for the model file to be saved.; row 3, column 4 = Conditionally Required; row 3, column 5 = ; row 4, column 1 = Selection options; row 4, column 2 = Technique; row 4, column 3 = Set the method of variable selection.; row 4, column 4 = Required; row 4, column 5 = General, Stepwise; row 5, column 1 = ; row 5, column 2 = Significance Level for Entry; row 5, column 3 = Enter Significance Level of Entry if Technique is Stepwise. The smaller the significance level, the fewer independent variables are likely to be added to the model.; row 5, column 4 = Required; row 5, column 5 =
table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Technique Set the method of variable selection. Required General, Stepwise
Significance Level for Entry Enter Significance Level of Entry if Technique is Stepwise. The smaller the significance level, the fewer independent variables are likely to be added to the model. Required
Significance Level for Removal Enter Significance Level of Removal if Technique is Stepwise. The bigger the significance level, the fewer independent variables are likely to be added to the model. Required
Calculate VIFs Decide whether to calculate VIFs. Multicollinearity is considered present if the VIF exceeds 10. Required True, False
Save Confidence Intervals Decide whether to save 95% Confidence Intervals for the dependent variable. Required True, False
Save Prediction Intervals Decide whether to save 95% of prediction intervals. Required True, False
Remove Multicollinearity Decide whether to remove variables to mitigate multicollinearity among independent variables. Required True, False
Regression Method Select a regression analysis method. Required OLS, Ridge, Lasso, Elastic Net
Ridge Penalty Enter the Penalty for Ridge if Regression Method is Ridge. Required
Lasso Penalty Enter the Penalty for LASSO if Regression Method is Lasso Required

Context:
This table is about the section 3.4 Modeling Nod e > 3.4.26 RL_AC (Actor Critic). 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = [image:rId516] [image:rId517]; row 1, column 2 = Actor Critic (AC) is a reinforcement learning algorithm in the Policy Gradient method that introduces an additional neural network, allowing two networks to be updated simultaneously. One network approximates the policy, while the other serves as a replacement for the Q function.
table_html: [image:rId516] [image:rId517] Actor Critic (AC) is a reinforcement learning algorithm in the Policy Gradient method that introduces an additional neural network, allowing two networks to be updated simultaneously. One network approximates the policy, while the other serves as a replacement for the Q function.

Context:
This table is about the section 3.4 Modeling Nod e > 3.4.26 RL_AC (Actor Critic) > Node Properties. 
Title: Node Properties 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = Property group; row 1, column 2 = Property Name; row 1, column 3 = Description; row 1, column 4 = Misc.; row 1, column 5 = Note; row 2, column 1 = Model File; row 2, column 2 = Save Model File; row 2, column 3 = Decide whether to save model file.; row 2, column 4 = Required; row 2, column 5 = Yes, No; row 3, column 1 = ; row 3, column 2 = Model File Path; row 3, column 3 = Set the path for the model file to be saved.; row 3, column 4 = Conditionally Required; row 3, column 5 = ; row 4, column 1 = Selection options; row 4, column 2 = Model Setting; row 4, column 3 = Select the gms file to load as an environment model.; row 4, column 4 = Required; row 4, column 5 = ; row 5, column 1 = ; row 5, column 2 = Discount Rate(gamma); row 5, column 3 = Set the discount rate(gamma) for the future reward.; row 5, column 4 = Required; row 5, column 5 = 0<real number<1
table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Model Setting Select the gms file to load as an environment model. Required
Discount Rate(gamma) Set the discount rate(gamma) for the future reward. Required 0<real number<1
Actor Learning Rate Specify the Learning Rate for the Actor neural network. Required 0<real number<1
Critic Learning Rate Specify the learning rate of the Critic neural network. Required 0<real number<1
Max Episodes Specify the maximum number of episodes to learn. Required Integer
Max Steps Specify the number of maximum steps in an episode. Required Integer
Target Variable Specifies a Target value for the variable to be controlled. Required Discrete Variables
Target Tolerance Specify the allowable error margin for the target value when defining the environmental reward. Required Integer
Target Upper Limit Specify the condition for ending an episode. The episode ends when the predicted value in the environmental model exceeds the specified value Required Real number
Target Lower Limit Specify the condition for ending an episode. The episode ends when the predicted value in the environmental model is below the specified value Required Real number
Control Variable Specify the control variables in Environmental Model. Required
Control Amount Specify the Control Amount of the control variable. Required Integer
Batch Normalization Decide whether to use batch normalization. Required Yes, No
Output Layer Activation Function Specifies the Activation Function of the output layer. Required Linear, Sigmoid, ReLU, Leaky ReLU, SoftMax
Hidden Layer Configuration Add Hidden Layer Add hidden layer Optional
Remove Last Hidden Layer Remove the last hidden layer. Optional
Hidden Layer # Number of nodes Specify the number of nodes for each specified hidden layer Required Integer
Activation Function Select the activation function for the specified hidden layer. Required Linear, Sigmoid, ReLU, Leaky ReLU, SoftMax

Rows: row 1, column 1 = [image:rId520] [image:rId521]; row 1, column 2 = Deep Deterministic Policy Gradients (DDPGs) is reinforcement learning algorithm that predicts a continuous action. table_html: [image:rId520] [image:rId521] Deep Deterministic Policy Gradients (DDPGs) is reinforcement learning algorithm that predicts a continuous action. Similar to the Actor-Critic method, it uses one neural network to approximate the policy and another to update the Q function.

table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Model Setting Select the gms file to load in model. Required
Discount Rate(gamma) Set the discount rate(gamma) for the future reward. Required 0<real number <1
Actor Learning Rate Specify the learning rate for the Actor network. Required 0<real number <1
Critic Learning Rate Specify the learning rate of the Critic neural network. Required 0<real number <1
Epsilon Specify the probability of choosing actions. When the probability is set to 0, the action with the highest Q-value is selected; when set to 1, actions are chosen completely at random. Required 0<real number <1
Epsilon Decay Rate Specify the decay rate of epsilon. Required 0<real number <1
Minimum Epsilon Value Specify the minimum value of Epsilon. Required 0<real number <1
Min Replay Memory Size Specifies the minimum size of replay memory for starting training. Required 0<Integer<N
Max Replay Memory Size Specify the maximum number of samples to be stored in replay memory. Required Integer
Batch Size Specify the number of sample batches to extract from memory for training. Required Integer
Max Episodes Specify the maximum number of episodes to learn. Required Integer
Max Steps Specify the number of maximum steps in an episode. Required Integer
Target Tolerance Specify the allowable error margin for the target value when defining the environmental reward. Required Integer
Batch Normalization Decide whether to use batch normalization. Required Yes, No
Set control, target Variable Specify control and target variables Required, Button
Output Layer Activation Function Specifies the Activation Function of the output layer. Linear, Sigmoid, ReLU, Leaky ReLU, SoftMax
Hidden Layer Configuration Add hidden layer Add hidden layer. Optional
Remove Last Hidden Layer Remove the last hidden layer Optional
Hidden Layer # Number of nodes Specify the number of nodes for each specified hidden layer Required Integer
Activation Function Select the activation function for the specified hidden layer. Required Linear, Sigmoid, ReLU, Leaky ReLU, SoftMax

Context:
This table is about the section 3.4 Modeling Nod e > 3.4.28 RL_DQN (Deep Q Network). 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = [image:rId524] [image:rId525]; row 1, column 2 = Deep Q Network (DQN) is a reinforcement learning algorithm that uses a neural network to perform Q-learning. It works by estimating the value of different actions in a given state and selecting the action with the highest value.
table_html: [image:rId524] [image:rId525] Deep Q Network (DQN) is a reinforcement learning algorithm that uses a neural network to perform Q-learning. It works by estimating the value of different actions in a given state and selecting the action with the highest value.

This allows for more stable and controlled policy improvements compared to traditional reinforcement learning algorithms.

table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Number of hidden layers Enter the number of hidden layers. Required Integer ≤ 3
Number of Nodes of hidden layers #1 Enter the number of nodes in the first hidden layer. Required Integer ≤ 100
Number of Nodes of hidden layers #2 Enter the number of nodes in the second hidden layer. Conditionally Required Integer ≤ 100
Number of Nodes of hidden layers #3 Enter the number of nodes in the third hidden layer. Conditionally Required Integer ≤ 100
Hidden Layer Activation Function Specifies the activation function of the hidden layer. Required ReLU, Tanh, Sigmoid
Weighting Initialization Specification Set the initial weight setting method for the neural network. Required Xavier, He, Custom
Weighting Initialization Standard Deviation Set the standard deviation of the initial weight values of the neural network. Conditionally Required 0.001≤real number≤100
Number of Epochs Specifies the maximum Number of Epochs for algorithm execution. Required natural number
Target Error Specifies the maximum allowable target error for training. Required 0≤real number
Optimization Technique Select Optimization Technique. Required SGD with Momentum, RMSProp, ADAM
Learning Rate When calculating the weight for the gradient direction during learning, enter the size of the degree of reflection of the direction from the previous step. Required 0≤real number≤1
Momentum In Gradient descent with momentum Optimization Technique, we set the degree to which the weight reflects the existing direction of movement. Conditionally Required 0≤real number≤1
Beta1 In ADAM Optimization Technique, sets the degree to which the weight reflects the existing direction of movement. Conditionally Required 0≤real number≤1
Beta2 Sets the rate at which ADAM Optimization Technique remembers previously updated weights. Conditionally Required 0≤real number≤1
Gamma Sets the rate at which previously updated weights are remembered in the RMSProp Optimization Technique. Conditionally Required 0≤real number≤1
Batch Size Specifies the Batch Size to be used when performing the BPTT algorithm for learning. Required Integer ≤ 200
Batch-Wise Method for Setting Initial Hidden Layer Value Select how to set the initial state of the hidden layer for each batch. Required Stateful, Stateless
Batch-Wise Initial Hidden Layer Value If you select Stateless as the method for setting the initial state of the hidden layer, enter the initial state setting value of the hidden layer for each batch. Conditionally Required 0≤real number≤1
Dropout If you select Stateless as the method for setting the initial state of the hidden layer, enter the initial state setting value of the hidden layer for each batch. Required Use, Not use
Dropout Proportion If you want to use Dropout, set the ratio to apply it. Conditionally Required 0≤real number≤1
Learning Log Sets the iteration frequency for displaying learning logs.

Rows: row 1, column 1 = [image:rId589]; row 1, column 2 = t-SNE (t-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding) is a multivariate data analysis technique that visualizes the classification and distribution in low dimensions through non-linear dimensionality reduction. It outperforms traditional linear dimensionality reduction methods, such as PCA and MDS, in visualizing data classification.
table_html: [image:rId589] t-SNE (t-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding) is a multivariate data analysis technique that visualizes the classification and distribution in low dimensions through non-linear dimensionality reduction. It outperforms traditional linear dimensionality reduction methods, such as PCA and MDS, in visualizing data classification.

table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Model File Save Model File Decide whether to save model file. Required Yes, No
Model File Path Set the path for the model file to be saved. Conditionally Required
Selection options Execution Count Set the total number of learning iterations. Required integer≥0 Default: 1000
Initial Perplexity Set the initial Perplexity value. Required The value should be between 5 and 50. However, it must be less than 1/3 of the number of input data (number of input matrix rows).
Learning Rate Constant Set the Learning Rate Constant value. Required The default is 100, and may be adjusted depending on the case.
Threshold Set the precision of calculation. Required The closer the threshold value is to 0, the higher the accuracy, but the longer the calculation time. Set to a real value greater than or equal to 0. Default: 0.5
Initial Momentum Set the initial momentum value. Required The Initial Momentum value is used for learning until the Number of Epochs reaches 250. Default: 0.5.
Final Momentum Set the final momentum value. Required The Final Momentum value is used for learning until the Number of Epochs reaches 250. Default: 0.8
Dimension Reduction Set the number of lower-dimensional dimensions you want to reduce. Required The dimensions that are easiest for visualization are 2D or 3D, so it is usually set to 2 or 3. Default: 2.

Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
DB Connection ODBC Editing Create a new DSN (Data Source Name) to connect ODBC. button
Data Source Select the DSN to use in the list of ODBC DSNs which are registered on a PC. Add the DSN by using ODBC editing if the DSN does not exist. Required

table_html: [image:rId596] OLEDB Writer is the node that stores data in a database using OLEDB (Object Linking and Embedding, Database) technology. Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Selection options Save Variable Names Select 'Yes' in the 'Save Variable Names' field saves it. Select 'No' creates a variable name automatically. Optional Yes, No
Storage Method Select 'overwrite' in the 'Storage Method' will discard existing data and write new data. If an identical file exists, the data will not be saved, and an error will occur. Optional Overwrite, Error if same file exists
Delimiter Select the type of delimiter. Supported delimiters are tab, space, bar, comma, semicolon, and colon. To use a different delimiter, select the 'Other' option. Required (tab) (Space) (|) (,) (;) (:) (Other)
Other Delimiter Set other delimiters in case the property of a delimiter is (Other). Required
Wrap in Quotation Marks Choose whether to wrap a string in quotation marks on a file. Required Yes, No
File File Path Enter the name and path of a file to save. Required
Use FTP Select whether to save and upload a file into an FTP server. Required Yes, No

Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
Selection options Save Variable Names Select 'Yes' in the 'Save Variable Names' field saves it. Select 'No' creates a variable name automatically. Optional Yes, No
Storage Method Select 'overwrite' in the 'Storage Method' will discard existing data and write new data. If an identical file exists, the data will not be saved, and an error will occur. Optional Overwrite, Error if same file exists
Delimiter Select the type of delimiter. Supported delimiters are tab, space, bar, comma, semicolon, and colon. To use a different delimiter, select the 'Other' option. Required (tab) (Space) (|) (,) (;) (:) (Other)
Other Delimiter Set other delimiters in case the property of a delimiter is (Other). Required
Wrap in Quotation Marks Choose whether to wrap a string in quotation marks on a file. Required Yes, No
File File Path Enter the name and path of a file to save. Required
Use FTP Select whether to save and upload a file into an FTP server. Required Yes, No
Connect to FTP FTP Server Choose an FTP server to use.
FTP User Enter user ID of FTP.
FTP Password Enter password of FTP.
FTP File Selection Select the file of FTP. Button
FTP File Path Enter the path to save a file on an FTP server.
Variable Information Variable Information Show the field name of the variable which save in a file.

This table is about the section 3.5 Output Node > 3.5.8 Separate File > Node Properties. 
Title: Node Properties 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = Property group; row 1, column 2 = Property Name; row 1, column 3 = Description; row 1, column 4 = Misc.; row 1, column 5 = Note; row 2, column 1 = File; row 2, column 2 = File Path; row 2, column 3 = Specify the name and path of a file to save.; row 2, column 4 = Required; row 2, column 5 = ; row 3, column 1 = Selection options; row 3, column 2 = Save Variable Names; row 3, column 3 = Specify whether to save a variable name.; row 3, column 4 = Optional (Default: Yes); row 3, column 5 = Yes, No; row 4, column 1 = ; row 4, column 2 = Storage Method; row 4, column 3 = Select 'overwrite' in the 'Storage Method' will discard existing data and write new data. If an identical file exists, the data will not be saved, and an error will occur.; row 4, column 4 = Optional (Default: Overwrite); row 4, column 5 = Overwrite, Error if a file exists; row 5, column 1 = ; row 5, column 2 = Delimiter; row 5, column 3 = Select the type of delimiter. Supported delimiters are tab, space, bar, comma, semicolon, and colon. To use a different delimiter, select the 'Other' option.; row 5, column 4 = Required; row 5, column 5 = (tab) (Space) (|) (,) (;) (:) (Other)
table_html:
Property group Property Name Description Misc. Note
File File Path Specify the name and path of a file to save. Required
Selection options Save Variable Names Specify whether to save a variable name. Optional (Default: Yes) Yes, No
Storage Method Select 'overwrite' in the 'Storage Method' will discard existing data and write new data. If an identical file exists, the data will not be saved, and an error will occur. Optional (Default: Overwrite) Overwrite, Error if a file exists
Delimiter Select the type of delimiter. Supported delimiters are tab, space, bar, comma, semicolon, and colon. To use a different delimiter, select the 'Other' option. Required (tab) (Space) (|) (,) (;) (:) (Other)
Other Delimiter Set other delimiters in case the property of a delimiter is (Other).
Wrap in Quotation Marks Choose whether to wrap a string in quotation marks on a file. Optional (Default: No) Yes, No
Reference Variable Select the variable which is criteria of a file separation. Once the Reference Variable option is defined, refer to <Separated storage method when a reference variable is set> below. Required None
File Separation Criteria Specify the criteria for separating a file. Options include the number of data entries, the number of files, or the category of the reference variable. Required Data Count, Number of Files, Reference Variable by Category
Number of File Separation Select this option if file separation is based on the number of files. Conditionally Required
Number of Data Separation Select this option if file separation criteria is based on the number of data entries. Conditionally Required
Variable Information Variable Information Show the name and type of the variable which is displayed in a table.
<Separated storage method when a reference variable is set> If file separation criteria is based on the number of data entries. For example, the option for the number of data entries to separate takes precedence over a reference variable. If the separation number is set to 10 and the reference variable is set to 'A', data are initially separated based on 10 entries. The 10th and 11th values of variable 'A' are then compared: A. If the values are identical, they are combined to form a set of 11 data entries. B. If the values differ, the 10 data entries are saved separately. After saving, the next group of 10 data entries is separated and processed in the same manner. This process continues, dividing a large data file into multiple smaller files. If file separation criteria is based on the number of files. When setting the number of files, the data separation number must be internally defined to divide the entire dataset. The dataset is divided based on the specified number of files. Example: If 100 rows of data are separated into 6 files, the separation number is 17.
